press_reference_link.label: Altris secures €4.8 million (SEK 50M) of bridge financing and gears up management with new CEO and CFO

news_insight_text_link.news_insight_description: Altris, based in Sweden, has entered into an exclusive agreement with Clarios for the development of low voltage sodium cells, marking a significant step in battery technology collaboration. Additionally, Altris is partnering with Stora Enso and a Swiss battery maker to innovate tree-based energy storage solutions, utilizing lignin for a more sustainable alternative.

overview_description.description: Altris develops a new sodium-ion battery cathode material that is made entirely of abundant and environmental materials. Altris was founded in 2017 to develop highly sustainable cathode materials for rechargeable sodium batteries to enable a sustainable future.

properties.growth_insight_description: Altris may be growing as it is mentioned as a key vendor in the sodium-ion battery market, which is projected to expand by USD 414.4 million from 2024 to 2028. This market growth indicates a rising demand for sodium-ion batteries, potentially increasing Altris's revenue and market presence. Furthermore, the company's involvement in an industry that is experiencing an increase in demand for high-capacity and lightweight batteries, particularly in consumer electronics, suggests that Altris is well-positioned to benefit from these market trends.
